summary.subject: SPECIAL ISSUE ON Emerging Concerns in Technical Debt Management for publication in the EMSE Journal
summary.announcement: A special issue focusing on Emerging Concerns in Technical Debt Management will be published in the Empirical Software Engineering (EMSE) journal.

scope.description: The issue invites contributions that investigate how emerging concerns in AI, data-intensive systems, and other evolving domains affect the understanding and management of Technical Debt (TD).
issues: Data Quality and Evolution: Poor data quality can create significant 'data debt.'
Ethical and Fairness Considerations: Managing fairness and transparency in AI creates new types of debt.
Scalability Challenges: Rapidly scalable systems can incur architectural debt.
examples: Data-driven systems relying on machine learning and analytics.
AI-enabled systems including machine learning pipelines and autonomous decision-making.
Cyber-physical systems like autonomous vehicles and robotics.
Distributed and cloud-native architectures complicating TD through evolving interfaces.
Emerging security and privacy concerns intersecting with TD.

topics_of_interest: Manifestations of TD in new systems.
Case studies of real-world TD experiences.
Longitudinal studies on the lifecycle of TD.

submission_details.format: Authors do not need to submit using a prescribed template; accepted articles will be formatted for SpringerLink.
submission_details.pre_screening: May take several days before assignment to guest editors.
submission_details.publishing: Articles published online first and are citable by DOI.
